intro: Timonius wollastonii, commonly known as the Wollaston's timonius, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Timonieae tribe within the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in compact clusters. The plant is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for taxonomic and ecological studies.
